Welcome to the latest edition of the Haxe Roundup. Haxe is a high level, strictly typed programming language and cross-compiler.

Community Updates

News and Articles

  • A rewrite of the PHP compiler target is being actively worked on, help shape its future!
  • The HaxeFlixel fundraiser is nearly at $7K, currently 221% of its total, with Kongregate buying a gold sponsorship and getting extra goodies added!
  • Dox, the Haxe documentation lib, has been updated!
  • Lewis Lepton, the Kha tutorial series author, has outlined his future plans on Patreon.
  • DC/AC virtual labs full wave rectifier walk through.
  • The linc_steam_api library gets a progress update.
  • Harfang 1.0.0, a Haxe web framework, has been published.
  • A hidden Haxe compiler ability.

Updates from the Haxe core

New Proposals

  • Have an idea to improve Haxe, create a proposal.

Core Changes

264 commits have been made to Haxe compiler in the last couple of weeks.

  • A brand new PHP generator is being worked on in a separate repo.
  • as3hx is still seeing rapid improvements.
  • The Haxe cookbook has a wish list of wanted articles to be contributed by the community.
  • Who will help implement IPV6 support?
  • Proper UTF-8 code point encoding possibly coming to the compiler.
  • Improved Windows compiler build support and instructions.

You can start using the latest features by grabbing a nightly build of Haxe.

Take it easy everyone and have a good week!
